section.related-content:
Ask some questions like how changing values of R & C can affect the charging time.

The charge is flowing from the battery to the plates of the capcitor which means current is flowing
The voltage across the capacitor increases as the charge accumulates.
The voltage difference decreases.
The current now decreases because of the decreasing voltage difference.
Since the current increases the voltage across the capacitor which eventually decreases the current we can say the current leads voltage in a capacitor

Show the analogy in an animation. Capacitor is a water tank, voltage is the pressure, water is the current, pipe is the resistor. Size of the tank = value of the capacitor

section.title: Charging with DC Source
section.content: Charging with DC Source The Voltage across the capacitor approaches the applied voltage - but at a rate that diminishes towards zero as Vcap approaches the applied voltage. It starts out strongly charging at 10mA but as it is 1V away it has slowed to 1/10 its rate.

section.title: Square Wave Response – slow change
section.content: Square Wave Response – slow change Since we have seen that a time of 5T where T = R*C is needed for the capacitor to charge fully, let us first take a time period of the square wave large enough to charge the capacitor. So we take Time period of Square wave > > RC. So in effect, this square wave is changing slowly.

section.title: Square Wave Response – slow change
section.content: Square Wave Response – slow change View the results in the Oscilloscope. Notice that the output across the capacitor is nearly same as the input as we allow the capacitor enough time to charge or discharge fully.

section.content: Square Wave Response – fast change Since we have taken a source which changes slowly and allows the capacitor to charge/discharge fully, let us first take a time period of the square wave the changes fast now. So we take Time period of Square wave << RC. Let us construct the circuit and observe its changes to this fast changing signal.
